intro: Leschenaultia divaricata, commonly known as the variable leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the south-western regions of Western Australia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal areas. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a somewhat hairy texture. Leschenaultia divaricata is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in open woodlands or scrub habitats.
